meanings.definition: In a way that causes physical or emotional discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The child cried painfully after falling off the swing.
meanings.sent2: She winced painfully as the dentist drilled into her tooth.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his dance moves were so painfully awkward, he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The truth hit her painfully, like a sharp slap to the face.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the accident was etched painfully in his mind.

meanings.definition: To an extreme or excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: She painfully regretted not studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: The athlete pushed himself painfully to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The cake was painfully sweet, making everyone pucker their lips.
meanings.sent4: His words painfully pierced her heart, leaving her in tears.
meanings.sent5: The sunburn made his skin painfully sensitive to touch.
